CIPHER.293.cipherString: Daring to face all hardships, the human race dashes through every human and divine restraint.
CIPHER.293.question: A quote by Horace has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.293.author: Horace

CIPHER.277.cipherString: Clear thinking at the wrong moment can stifle creativity.
CIPHER.277.question: Baconian Sequence Quote Author: Karl Lagerfeld
CIPHER.277.author: Karl Lagerfeld

CIPHER.273.cipherString: When you set your mind to achieve something, you must allow yourself the opportunity to get it done.
CIPHER.273.question: Decode this quote by Tasha Hoggatt which has been encoded using the Caesar Cipher.
CIPHER.273.author: Tasha Hoggatt

CIPHER.292.cipherString: El éxito no es permanente y la derrota no es fatal; lo que cuenta es el coraje para continuar.
CIPHER.292.question: A quote by an unknown person in Spanish has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. It has been encoded using a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.292.author: Unknown
CIPHER.292.translation: Success is not permanent and defeat is not fatal; what counts is the courage to continue.

CIPHER.271.cipherString: Success will be within your reach only when you start reaching out for it.
CIPHER.271.question: The following quote by Stephen Richards needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of TUBES
CIPHER.271.author: Stephen Richards

CIPHER.278.cipherString: I hope when I inevitably choke to death on gummy bears people just say I was killed by bears and leave it at that.
CIPHER.278.question: A quote by an unknown person has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it ends with the word THAT.
CIPHER.278.author: Unknown

CIPHER.270.cipherString: It has been my philosophy of life that difficulties vanish when faced boldly.
CIPHER.270.question: A quote by Isaac Asimov has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has IFETHAT somewhere in it.
CIPHER.270.author: Isaac Asimov

CIPHER.288.cipherString: Men ilve best upon a little: nature hsa ordained awl too eb hapy, if they would but learn how two ewes her gifts.
CIPHER.288.question: Decode a quote by Claudius that has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher.  Unfortunately the message was received over a bad connection, so there are some errors in it.
CIPHER.288.author: Claudius

CIPHER.283.cipherString: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.
CIPHER.283.question: The following quote by Dalai Lama needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of JOKES and polybius key of PUBLISHED.
CIPHER.283.author: Dalai Lama

CIPHER.286.cipherString: A certain type of perfection can only be realized through a limitless accumulation of the imperfect.
CIPHER.286.question: A quote by Haruki Murakami has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it contains the word CAN.
CIPHER.286.author: Haruki Murakami

CIPHER.287.cipherString: A happy man is too satisfied with the present to dwell too much on the future.
CIPHER.287.question: The following quote by Albert Einstein needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of DOZEN and polybius key of FACTORIES.
CIPHER.287.author: Albert Einstein

CIPHER.291.cipherString: Instruction ends in the schoolroom, but education ends only with life. A child is given to the universe to be educated.
CIPHER.291.question: A quote by Frederick William Robertson has been encoded using the K2 Patristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it begins with INSTR.
CIPHER.291.author: Frederick William Robertson

CIPHER.272.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 85046 0461 584937 23981. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.274.cipherString: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless; peacocks and lilies for instance.
CIPHER.274.question: A quote by John Ruskin has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.274.author: John Ruskin

CIPHER.285.cipherString: Music is love in search of a word.
CIPHER.285.question: The following quote by Sidney Lanier needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=5 and b=3.
CIPHER.285.author: Sidney Lanier

CIPHER.276.cipherString: Finding the lesson behind every adversity will be the one important thing that helps get you through it.
CIPHER.276.question: A quote by Roy T. Bennett has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it contains the word WILL.
CIPHER.276.author: Roy T. Bennett

CIPHER.275.cipherString: Because you are alive, everything is possible.
CIPHER.275.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.275.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

CIPHER.280.cipherString: It never seems to occur to some people, that, like beauty, a sense of humor may sometimes be fatal.
CIPHER.280.question: A quote by Edgar Rice Burroghs has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.280.author: Edgar Rice Burroghs

CIPHER.279.cipherString: The simple and familiar hold the secrets of the complex and unknown.
CIPHER.279.question: Decode this quote by Edward B. Burger which has been encoded using the Atbash Cipher.
CIPHER.279.author: Edward B. Burger

CIPHER.282.cipherString: The goal of life is to make everyone and everything around you happy. With your act of kindness and compassion.
CIPHER.282.question: A quote by Shree Shambav has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.282.author: Shree Shambav

CIPHER.289.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 2689 4892 3460 1577. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.290.cipherString: Breakthroughs arise when someone can combine many ideas together. Think broadly, not deeply.
CIPHER.290.question: A quote by Joshua Krook has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it contains the word CAN.
CIPHER.290.author: Joshua Krook

CIPHER.281.cipherString: Try not to have a good time... this is supposed to be educational.
CIPHER.281.question: A quote by Charles M. Schulz has been encoded using the Fractionated Morse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has TO HAVE in it corresponding to the encoded text X L Y D T R S G, meaning D = ●●●; G = ●××; L = –––; R = ×●●; S = ●–×; T = ×●–; X = ×–×; Y = ××●.
CIPHER.281.author: Charles M. Schulz

CIPHER.284.cipherString: Leaders live by choice, not by accident.
CIPHER.284.question: The following strange phrases encode a quote by Mark Gorman using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the cipher text AMAZE FIERY AGING HAIRY COBRA decodes to be BYACC
CIPHER.284.author: Mark Gorman
